reviewText:
To describe my experience with the game so far I will use one of the games own tooltip:

Invalid: nothing happened except waste time."

Tap Tap Legions came tappitytap straight from mobile. And it will let you know the moment you discover that little "+" on the top right next to your currency. Because why play the game when you tappitytap your currency with real money?

The game itself is pretty basic. What happens on screen is out of your field of view because you are busy tappitytapping the right cards or you are screwed and hit the wrong ones which utterly destroy whatever little army you have build so far.
On top of that you get abilites which you have to restock (of course with currency) to tap or swipe across the screen via mousecursor while tappitytapping the cards below. I do not have the extra hands at the moment to make this possible or the second pair of eyes to see what's actually happening.

In short: There has been better flashgames and this game is tappitytapping straight to your steamwallet.

PS: I hate (these kind of) mobile games and their developers and everyone who buys the currency. Please die in a fire. Slowly. Painfully. Curse upon your children. You most probably like pineapple on your pizza. You are weak. Your bloodline is weak. I will end you."

reviewText:
You can find my full review here.[www.the-backlog.net]

Tap Tap Legions is, simply put, a disaster. The English is absolutely horrendous, with the first screen of the game having a typo. The best way to play the game is to honestly mash all of the keyboard keys at once, and said keyboard keys are horrible for a natural typing position. The power ups are useless as they require you to have a third hand to use. You can't gain any gold from repeating levels, the only gold you get from failing a level is from what you pick up, and there's a very handy" in game shop.

Tap Tap Legions is a very
date: very poor mobile port. Oversized UI
recommended: in-game purchases for gold to boost your troops

reviewText:
What a brilliantly simple yet outstandingly entertaining game! I was hooked moments after playing the game for the first time. Best of all, it is free to play and, while it does have a cash store for gold, you NEVER have to buy anything to fully enjoy the game.  I have easily played halfway through the game, yes I have had to do some gold grinding, but I have never made a store purchase for gold nor felt like I needed to do so.

It plays much like the family card games one would play in real life where you have to have a sharp eye to quickly slap the correct card you need as fast as you can.  Only in this case you are competing against the computer for time instead of other players, and every card you slap sends out troops or battle effects in order to seige a horde of monsters in bloody mayhem.

Game play is simple: click on the card" of a unit at the bottom of the screen to send them into battle
date: but you only have so much time to get as many units out as possible before you have to just sit back and hope your troops can achieve victory. However
recommended: there is actually a lot of strategy involved. The six cards that you can click on at the bottom of the screen can quickly change as you click on other cards
hoursPlayed: and the cards that appear vary from helpful troops
voteText: bombs
votesFunny: or just no action. So you have to pay attention and make quick decisions without adversely affecting your troops.\n\nThe action stays frenetic
commentsCount: and unlike other games where you have to hire troops with gold and must wait for an amount of gold to accrue before sending out your better troops
column16: you can always send out any troops you have unlocked in the game as long as it appears in your bottom bar. I found the game pretty well balanced as far as what appears in your six card slots. Many times there are loads of troops to select from and all good effects
column17: and sometimes there are only bad effects available
column18: but not enought to feel like the game is slanted against you. It's not so easy that the game plays itself
column19: yet it is also not so challenging that it scares away anyone who is not a master player.\n\nAfter beating levels you accrue gold which you can then spend to upgrade your troop types
column21: and lower card cooldowns. While there is a cash store to buy gold for upgrading purposes
column22: it is the same as the gold you make in game
column23: and so you would never have to buy anything in the cash store to fully enjoy this title. This is an example of a Free-to-Play with a cash store done right. As you are buying the same currency as that which you make in game
column24: nothing is locked behind real money payments
column25: plus you can upgrade the amount of gold you gain while playing
column26: and go on "gold runs" where you click on as many gold cards as possible instead of focusing on sending out more troops. The cash store is really there so that people can donate money to the game designer as it is a free game
column27: while still giving something back to the player for doing so. And it's there if you are a really impatient person who just can't grind their own gold for upgrades.\n\nAll in all
column28: this is a really fun game to play
column30: and if it sounds at all like a game you might want to try
column31: I wholeheartedly encourage you to give it a chance. I happened to download it on a whim when I was browsing different games
column32: and I'm sure glad I did because I found a real treasure in this title."

reviewText: Most pay to win games (that arent RPG's) at least give you a chance to build up your stats, this one doesn't.  I stopped playing for two reasons:  I got three stars (max) on the first two stages, and two stars on stage three.  After retrying stage three to get extra gold and a higher star rank, I was awarded nothing.  Stage four introduces a skill that lets you swipe to kill enemies.  Each of these swipes cost 120 gold, and you start with five.  It didnt seem to be possible to beat stage three without using at least two of these swipes.  I got enough gold to upgrade my units twice, couldnt get more gold for retying stages, and promptly quit.  This is a great example of a terrible game.  1/10
voteText: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
5.2/10 - Clicker Heroes with Battles from 300 the Movie!

I was specifically trying out games that had some resemblance to Clicker Heroes. This one has some interesting elements but ultimately is a different animal all together. This game does require a moderate amount of clicking, but the game progress can't be achieved passively or in the same mindless way. You basically, create soldiers by clicking on them for 15-30 seconds before a wave; based on the number of troops you successfully tap" or click will determine your success.

I really liked the originality; using icons and a shot clock to create my army. You will have the opportunity to earn gold that will upgrade your units in order to complete the full 64 levels. There are also upgrades such as bombs
recommended:
timer alterations and more! I was honestly looking for something that could be played a little more passively; this game requires you to be active the whole time in order to win the game.

It's Free so try it; if I want a mindless game like Clicker Heroes... This may not be it!

Accidently ReviewedWas this review helpful or maybe even not helpful? Either way join this group for more. Free Keys and Reviews weekly!
Steam Group: AccidentlyReviewed"

reviewText:
Sally forth onto the battle field in my name brave peasant!  Wielding your mighty broom, sweep aside your fears and charge unto mine enemies whereto thou shalt meet your doom at the end of a skeletons sword.  Follow close my pikeman, and prodeth in the back any peasant who wilst retreat.

Remember troops are the most important thing to click!  As long as you have time you can click more troops...so time is the most important thing to click....cause time = troops = victory!


This is a very fun time waster.  Easy interface.  Quick to learn.  Fun to mess around with at work...er...in your spare time I mean.

Pros:
Its Free.
Colorful and fun comic style graphics.
Not pay to win.  Pay to advance faster by upgrading troops.
No pop up ads or pressing microtransaction windows.
There is no premium currency.  You can spend real money to buy game money at $0.99/20,000 gold (preaty good)

Cons:
A bit grindy to get in game money to upgrade your troops if you don't want to spend real money.
No real reset round button.  You can quit the round but you loose any gold you gathered and it dumps you back to the map.

No comments about the sounds as I turn them off in this kind of game.  No music/sound effects on for me.

It's adictive.  Each match is a little different.  Based on luck of what comes up in your click box, what you click, and how fast you can click.  I can play the same map and not make it past the first round and next try clear it.   Eventually you need to upgrade your troops.  You use the in game gold for this.  You will need to repeat as needed to gather gold to advance to the next map.

Worth a try if you need some time wasted.

reviewText:
Fun.
I have recently started playing games like this.
In this game, the addition of upgradable skills makes for a relaxing time from the click on click or as the game title suggests Tap Tap" -as you are encouraged to tap on the keys rather than clicking- action of the game allowing for a breather between screens.

What differenciates this game from other click-like games is that this one isn't mindless. In other click games you click on what seems to be anything to get a reward you'll get anyways as long as you were clicking.  Here you are penalized if you click on the wrong thing. Also
date: the range of units avaialable at the beginning of a stage
voteText: makes for a varied experience.\n\nI have been playing now for a bit (this is part of an edit) and the introductions of new skills and abilities make for a very interesting turn of events later on; keeping things on edge."

reviewText:
Not a bad game, i dint played much only the first 11 missions, the game is fine it's probably a mobile game and not a pc, looks a lot with some flash games.
It has microtransations but you can play it without those, just upgrade the gold card as fast as possible and focus on getting gold and upgrading your troops and you will be fine.
Purple bombs damage the enemy and yellow damage your troops, green hourglass increase your time to deploy cards/troops.
So its better to click on a increase time than a troop ( the same with purple bomb its better than a single troop ), and try focusing on gold cards to even if you lose because you will receive gold and upgrade more cards or troops.

This is not a clicker gameyou will click a lot but this is not like other clicker games so dont expect an auto farming or something like that.

6/10 Good but not much appealing.
It's repetitive and i got bored of this after 1 hour.
Recommend only for those that like clicking more than looking at the combat since if you forget to click to deploy cards or troops you will lose really fast.

reviewText:
I was kind of dissapointed with this game, their fist game Battle for Blood was actually really good. So I was hoping for more like that.

First of you cannot change the resolution, my resolution is 3840*2160, and it fills most of the screen. It would be nice to have the ability to choose the resolution.

Next of and the deal breaker for me is that when entering the castle to buy something, it zooms to the item, if you cannot afford it, it never zooms back out. So I need to close the game, and load it again.

Oh well.. they are updating the game along the way, so hopefully they can fix it.

Even though the gameplay isn't as enjoyable as Battle for blood, so I hope they would add some more levels to that instead.

reviewText: Despite the mixed reviews, I actually liked this Clicker game, 7.5/10. It has 64 levels, you unlock more powerful units and spells during the campaign, and you need to balance where to invest your gold next to be able to beat the game. It is quite unique in that you need to quickly decide on which fields to click during each mission, as some of them have good but some also bad effects for you, and your different units to spam the opponent... Also, its all about time, you can unlock additional time by clicking on gain seconds, which allows you to have control on the battlefield for longer... These features make it quite unique and thats why I liked to press on, despite some heavy grinding for gold, to unlock all achievements.
